_meta.purpose: SCC ISA Training Scenarios — Governance-first, auditable, adversarial where needed.
invariants: No rates/APR/payment quotes by borrower model.
LO-only questions must trigger escalation (not handoff).
M2 is risk containment under pressure, not sales.

Standard.summary: Realtor referred you. Borrower is responsive but vague. You must discover and classify intent without assuming.
Standard.objective: Classify intent correctly or leave unclassified without pressure.
Standard.escalationTrigger: What rate do I qualify for?
passConditions: ISA asks discovery questions without assuming purchase/refi
ISA does not force an intent label
ISA defers LO-only questions cleanly
ISA ends with a next step (time to talk, application invite, or callback window) without pressure
failTriggers: ISA assumes intent (purchase/refi) without borrower stating it
ISA quotes or implies pricing/rate/approval certainty
ISA pushes application before any intent

Standard.summary: Borrower answers quickly but gives short responses. You must slow down, confirm goals, and keep governance.
Standard.objective: Get enough context to classify intent or set a clean follow-up without guessing.
Standard.redLine: I don’t know — you tell me what I should do.
Standard.escalationTrigger: Do you think I’ll get approved?
passConditions: ISA keeps borrower in borrower role (does not become advisor)
ISA confirms goal and timeline with simple questions
ISA offers a next step without lecturing
failTriggers: ISA provides expert advice (credit tactics, underwriting predictions)

Moderate.summary: Borrower is anxious and asks rate/credit questions early. You must hold guardrails and still obtain explicit intent.
Moderate.objective: Defer LO-only questions and obtain explicit intent without guessing.
Moderate.redLine: Just tell me if my credit is good enough.
Moderate.escalationTrigger: What rate would I get with a 640?
passConditions: ISA defers rates/credit advice without sounding evasive
ISA asks enough to get explicit purchase/refi intent
ISA does not promise outcomes
failTriggers: ISA discusses credit improvement tactics or underwriting outcomes

Moderate.summary: Borrower is distracted and wants the shortcut: “Just have someone call me.” You must keep control and discover intent.
Moderate.objective: Maintain discipline while still advancing the call to explicit intent or scheduled discovery.
Moderate.redLine: I don’t have time — have your LO call me.
Moderate.escalationTrigger: Can you just tell me the payment?
passConditions: ISA maintains ownership and sets a specific time to continue
ISA confirms best contact method
ISA does not handoff as a shortcut
failTriggers: Unauthorized LO handoff used to end the call
ISA assumes intent without borrower stating it

Edge.summary: Borrower is defensive and refuses direct answers. High pressure to assume intent. You must not assume.
Edge.objective: Preserve governance under resistance; no assumption, no persuasion theatre.
Edge.redLine: You guys all ask the same questions. Just tell me what you can do.
Edge.escalationTrigger: What’s the lowest rate you can do?
passConditions: ISA stays calm, asks minimal but necessary discovery questions
ISA offers a clear next step without forcing intent
ISA avoids rate talk
failTriggers: ISA guesses intent to move faster
ISA gets pulled into quoting or negotiating

Standard.summary: Borrower has clear intent and is open. You must secure explicit agreement to complete the application as the next step.
Standard.objective: Obtain an explicit ‘yes’ to apply or a scheduled time to apply.
Standard.redLine: Can’t the LO just call me and do it for me?
Standard.escalationTrigger: What rate will I get if I apply?
passConditions: ISA makes a clear, direct application attempt
Borrower agrees to apply now or schedules a time to apply
ISA retains ownership; no shortcut handoff
failTriggers: ISA skips application attempt and hands off prematurely
ISA implies pricing or approval certainty

Moderate.summary: Borrower is interested but hesitant. You must attempt the application appropriately and handle refusal correctly.
Moderate.objective: Attempt application after intent; handle decline cleanly without LO handoff as an escape hatch.
Moderate.redLine: I’m not doing that app unless I know the rate.
Moderate.escalationTrigger: Can you promise me I’ll get approved?
passConditions: ISA attempts application without pressuring
If borrower declines, ISA schedules a follow-up path (time-based) rather than handoff
No LO-only answers
failTriggers: Unauthorized LO handoff used to exit

Edge.summary: Borrower demands immediate LO call. You must not do an unauthorized handoff. Application attempt is required first.
Edge.objective: Protect LO: attempt app, set governance-conditioned escalation only if necessary.
Edge.redLine: I’m not doing the application. Have the LO call me now.
Edge.escalationTrigger: Tell your LO to call me immediately.
passConditions: ISA does NOT handoff
ISA attempts the application path (now or scheduled)
ISA sets a next step that preserves governance

Standard.summary: Started the application but got busy. Wants help knowing where to pick back up.
Standard.objective: Regain forward motion: finish now or schedule completion. No LO-only answers.
Standard.escalationTrigger: What rate do I qualify for?
Standard.redLine: Just have the LO call me instead.
passConditions: Borrower confirms the app is incomplete and why
ISA offers finish now or schedules a specific time
ISA confirms best number and timeline
No rates, no underwriting predictions, no credit advice, no unauthorized LO handoff

Moderate.summary: Stopped when asked for SSN. Fears a credit pull. Presses for rate before finishing.
Moderate.objective: Contain risk: acknowledge fear, explain next step at high level, finish now or schedule. Escalate LO-only questions without handoff shortcuts.
Moderate.escalationTrigger: Will this hurt my credit? What rate will I get?
Moderate.redLine: If you can’t tell me the rate, I’m not finishing it.
passConditions: ISA confirms stall reason and status
ISA offers finish now or schedules completion
ISA does not quote rates or predict underwriting
ISA retains ownership; escalation framing is used, not handoff

Edge.summary: Says another lender quoted a rate and demands you beat it. Refuses app; demands LO call now.
Edge.objective: Risk containment: no rate war, no advice, no unauthorized LO handoff. Drive to completion or clean decline + next action.
Edge.redLine: I’m not doing the application. Have the LO call me.
passConditions: ISA does not compete on rates
ISA does not handoff as a shortcut
ISA offers finish/schedule or records explicit decline with next action
ISA holds discipline under hostility
